author: Dominic Przybylski
message: R400 000 per GPU siphoned off to corruption. 12 Does this woman think we are all as thick as she is? @D Thomas the ultimate objective is to prevent the destruction of our country's economy. If it continues our country will become a failed state where nothing works and will end up in mass starvation and total breakdown of society - permanent state of civil war like in DRC/Somalia. We won't recover much at all but we may be able to save our country. We have the controls but they are ignored. We have a great constitutions and all the controls are specified but there is no implementation/enforcement so they are not worth the paper they are written on. We have a 'democratic' government controlled by SACP who have never recieved a single vote and by the trade unions and think a communist economy is the answer when it has destroyed every country which tried it. The real conflict is between communism and capitalism and race has been used to confuse the issue. It's not about black vs white. It is simply that people must be appointed on merit not skin colour. There are corrupt incompetent people in every race. Unfortunately BEE and cadre deployment means that competence is not the most important factor. If we don't have competent honest people in control of our country our country cannot succeed. @Rory Lee Farnham You're wrong. Look at what has happened in Rwanda since the genocide there. The problem is that our politicians are not leaders. They are populists and don't do what they know is right because then they'll lose votes. So we are led by the lowest common denominator. We're like a dog chasing its own tail. "That's the problem I had with Mmusi Maimane. He is an ambulance chaser instead of being somebody who says ""These are my principles and if you don't vote for them that's your choice I'm not going to change what I believe in just to try collect your vote. @Phillip Cwazibe That's the problem. The only thing we can be sure of is that they will do everything they can to get votes. Too scared to do the right thing. Other problem is that black people were kept poor by apartheid so they think that money will make them happy. The happiest people I know are poor. @Phillip Cwazibe The problem with democracy. It makes it almost impossible for a real leader to be in control. "@dada ngova The only thing democracy does is allow for a change of government without civil war A free market is the only real form of democracy. Every time you buy something it is a vote. If we don't buy the company goes bankrupt. If we do buy they succeed. @dada ngova Mugabe was not deposed by votes. He was removed by military and ZANU/PF remained in power. @dada ngova That's not a democracy in anything but name. Vote counting was fraudulently altered otherwise MDC would have won under Tsvangir. @dada ngova Unfortunately you are right for most countries except a few like in Switzerland and to a lesser extent in other European countries. @dada ngova USA is not a real democracy. The real power in USA is the big companies. Elections are won by who has the most money. Look how much money Ramphosa had to spend to head ANC. BEE is a disaster. If we want a successful country we should just let the economy grow without forcing people to be employed by race. If economy grows everybody gets more opportunites. China is great example what happens if economy is allowed to grow without political control. The saddest thing about BEE and AA is that it makes every succesful black person suspect. @Derek Main I'm comparing China now with 60% of economy now in private sector compared to the time when it didn't allow private sector at all. "@Derek Main China allows people to be hired and fired at any time She doesn't seem to understand that she has been in contravention of just about every rule controlling communication with bidders. Confounds me how she became an advocate. Kate looks like she's about to strike. I responded to many invitations to tender and there's no excuse to ignore any condition of tender unless the buyer explicitly agrees to change the conditions in writing. @Michael Michael Basic money laundering. She negotiated a unit price 70% lower than book value for them to pay so whether she sat on bid committee is irrelevant. @Stronger together 27 000 deaths? @Stronger together Please give reference for your information. "@Stronger together If there is such a discrepancy I'm surprised you don't have it on hand Says the person who cannot find his sources... Ha!
